intro: Gastromeria, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of a single species, Gastromeria tenuifolia, which is native to the Canary Islands. The plant is characterized by its small, white, umbellate inflorescences that resemble ghostly apparitions, giving it its common name. It grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to arid conditions. The botanical features of Gastromeria include its aromatic leaves and its unique, ethereal floral display.
